title: How to Make Indian Potato Bread Rolls

methods.name: Making Spicy Indian Potato Bread Rolls

steps.headline: Place the frying pan on the stove top.
steps.description: Add the oil and heat gently over medium heat. Add the cumin seed and cook until it begins cracking. Then add the peas, green chili and ginger. Stir together briefly.

steps.headline: Add the mashed potato.
steps.description: Stir through. Then add the chili and mango powders, the salt and cilantro/coriander. Stir in and fry for a minute, then remove from the heat. Do a taste test to check that you like the flavor. It should be quite spicy as the bread will soften the taste a little.

steps.headline: Roll the filling mixture into small balls or cylinders, depending on your preference.
steps.description: Each ball or cylinder should contain about 1 and half tablespoons of the filling each. This will make around one dozen.

steps.headline: Trim the crusts off the bread slices.
steps.description: Cut into halves.

steps.headline: Dip the bread into water contained in a small bowl.
steps.description: Dip lightly (don't soak). Press between both palms to squeeze out the excess water. This is done to moisten the bread and make it easier to shape around the filling.

steps.headline: Place a shaped filling piece inside the center or one piece of bread.
steps.description: Press the bread around the ball or cylinder, molding it to the filling to form the roll.

steps.headline: Repeat until all the potato bread rolls have been formed.
steps.description: Set aside to firm for five to ten minutes. The water will also reduce during this time, which makes for better frying.

steps.headline: Place oil in a frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Heat over medium to high heat.

steps.headline: Add the potato bread rolls to the oil.
steps.description: Add only as many as the pan can handle without overlapping them. Drop in with care, as the oil will splatter.

steps.headline: Fry until the potato bread rolls turn a golden brown color.
steps.description: Turn them using a spatula or tongs every now and then. In all, they should cook within two to three minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the potato bread rolls from the pan and place onto kitchen paper to drain.
steps.description: Let sit briefly to drain.

steps.headline: Transfer to a serving dish.
steps.description: These go well with chutney of your choice.

methods.name: Garam Masala Indian Potato Bread Rolls

steps.headline: Mash the cooked potatoes.
Add the mashed potatoes and the peas to a frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Mix together well over medium heat/flame.

steps.headline: Add the garam masala and the chili powder.
steps.description: Mix well into the mixture.

steps.headline: Turn the heat down to low.
steps.description: Add the coriander leaves. Mix in well. Then turn off the heat and set aside.

steps.headline: Dip the bread into water.
steps.description: Drain the water by softly squeezing the bread.

steps.headline: Shape the stuffing mix into small balls.
steps.description: These balls can be circular or cylindrical, as preferred.

steps.headline: Shape the wet bread around the balls.
steps.description: Let sit to firm up and reduce the water content for about five to ten minutes. This improves their crispiness when fried.

steps.headline: Place oil in a frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Heat over medium to high heat.

steps.headline: Add the potato bread rolls to the oil.
steps.description: Add only as many as the pan can handle without overlapping them. Drop in with care, as the oil will splatter.

steps.headline: Fry until the potato bread rolls turn a golden brown color.
steps.description: Turn them using a spatula or tongs every now and then. In all, they should cook within two to three minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the potato bread rolls from the pan and place onto kitchen paper to drain.
steps.description: Let sit briefly to drain.

steps.headline: Transfer to a serving dish.
steps.description: These go well with chutney of your choice.

steps.headline: Peel and boil the potatoes.
steps.description: When boiled, mash them.

steps.headline: Pour a little oil into the frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Add the garlic and green chili pieces to the pan. Heat gently over a medium heat or flame. Add the lemon pieces as well, once the other pieces have cooked a little.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Tip the cooked garlic, chili and lemon pieces into the mashed potato. Stir to combine. Allow to cool sufficiently to handle.

steps.headline: Shape the lemony filling mixture into cylinder or ball shapes.
Cut the edges off the bread slices.
steps.description: Cut into halves. Dip briefly into water to dampen.

steps.headline: Wrap the dampened bread around the filling balls or cylinders.
steps.description: Use your fingers to mold into place. Seal the ends firmly with water. Once you dip the bread into water, press the bread hard with a clean cloth so that the extra water gets absorbed.

steps.headline: Deep fry the rolls in oil in a pan or pot.
steps.description: Fry the bread until it turns a reddish color.

steps.headline: Serve the lemony potato bread rolls with the sauce of your choice.

text: Making Spicy Indian Potato Bread Rolls Place the frying pan on the stove top. Add the oil and heat gently over medium heat. Add the cumin seed and cook until it begins cracking. Then add the peas, green chili and ginger. Stir together briefly. Add the mashed potato. Stir through. Then add the chili and mango powders, the salt and cilantro/coriander. Stir in and fry for a minute, then remove from the heat. Do a taste test to check that you like the flavor. It should be quite spicy as the bread will soften the taste a little. Roll the filling mixture into small balls or cylinders, depending on your preference. Each ball or cylinder should contain about 1 and half tablespoons of the filling each. This will make around one dozen. Trim the crusts off the bread slices. Cut into halves. Dip the bread into water contained in a small bowl. Dip lightly (don't soak). Press between both palms to squeeze out the excess water. This is done to moisten the bread and make it easier to shape around the filling. Place a shaped filling piece inside the center or one piece of bread. Press the bread around the ball or cylinder, molding it to the filling to form the roll. Repeat until all the potato bread rolls have been formed. Set aside to firm for five to ten minutes. The water will also reduce during this time, which makes for better frying. Place oil in a frying pan or skillet. Heat over medium to high heat. Add the potato bread rolls to the oil. Add only as many as the pan can handle without overlapping them. Drop in with care, as the oil will splatter. Fry until the potato bread rolls turn a golden brown color. Turn them using a spatula or tongs every now and then. In all, they should cook within two to three minutes. Remove the potato bread rolls from the pan and place onto kitchen paper to drain. Let sit briefly to drain. Transfer to a serving dish. These go well with chutney of your choice. Garam Masala Indian Potato Bread Rolls Mash the cooked potatoes.  Add the mashed potatoes and the peas to a frying pan or skillet. Mix together well over medium heat/flame. Add the garam masala and the chili powder. Mix well into the mixture. Turn the heat down to low. Add the coriander leaves. Mix in well. Then turn off the heat and set aside. Dip the bread into water. Drain the water by softly squeezing the bread. Shape the stuffing mix into small balls. These balls can be circular or cylindrical, as preferred. Shape the wet bread around the balls. Let sit to firm up and reduce the water content for about five to ten minutes. This improves their crispiness when fried. Place oil in a frying pan or skillet. Heat over medium to high heat. Add the potato bread rolls to the oil. Add only as many as the pan can handle without overlapping them. Drop in with care, as the oil will splatter. Fry until the potato bread rolls turn a golden brown color. Turn them using a spatula or tongs every now and then. In all, they should cook within two to three minutes. Remove the potato bread rolls from the pan and place onto kitchen paper to drain. Let sit briefly to drain. Transfer to a serving dish. These go well with chutney of your choice. Lemony Potato Bread Rolls Peel and boil the potatoes. When boiled, mash them. Pour a little oil into the frying pan or skillet. Add the garlic and green chili pieces to the pan. Heat gently over a medium heat or flame. Add the lemon pieces as well, once the other pieces have cooked a little. Remove from the heat. Tip the cooked garlic, chili and lemon pieces into the mashed potato. Stir to combine. Allow to cool sufficiently to handle. Shape the lemony filling mixture into cylinder or ball shapes.  Cut the edges off the bread slices. Cut into halves. Dip briefly into water to dampen. Wrap the dampened bread around the filling balls or cylinders. Use your fingers to mold into place. Seal the ends firmly with water. Once you dip the bread into water, press the bread hard with a clean cloth so that the extra water gets absorbed. Deep fry the rolls in oil in a pan or pot. Fry the bread until it turns a reddish color. Serve the lemony potato bread rolls with the sauce of your choice.
